div1.p: Gorgas asks Kean if he would like to assist in writing a book on tropical hygiene. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Jefferson Randolph Kean, January 22, 1910
div1.opener:
Referring to your File No.
ISTHMIAN CANAL COMMISSION
DEPARTMENT OF SANITATION
ANCON, CANAL ZONE
COL. W. C. GORGAS, U. S. A.
CHIEF SANITARY OFFICER.
In reply refer to File No.
January 22, 1910.
Colonel Jefferson R. Kean,
Office of the Surgeon General,
War Department,
Washington, D. C.
My dear Kean:
div1.p:
Dr. J. R. Broome of Appleton & Company has written me again
on the subject of getting up a general hygiene. I have recently
written the chapter on anti-malarial work in Ronald Ross' book con-
cerning prevention of malaria in general, which is soon to be
published by John Murray. This has rather whetted my appetite
and I begin to look with some fervor upon writing a chapter or
chapters on tropical hygiene, provided I can get somebody to do the
rest.
Have you thought anything more about it?
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, W. C. Gorgas. 63
I have just read the Secretary of War's report. It is very
complimentary to you. And what is better still all the compliment
in deserved. I think the law you got through & the reorganiza-
tion you made are the best that have been made in sanitary
matters.
